title: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

- Name: Isaiah Sept, Date of birth: 10-07-1973, Date of death: 02-03-2006

- Name: James Prinz, Date of birth: 10-17-1969, Date of death: 08-20-2017

- Name: Pete Coonce, Date of birth: 05-31-1998, Date of death: 11-14-2020

- Name: Lathina Decosta, Date of birth: 08-03-1993, Date of death: 11-14-2020

- Name: David Mandeville, Date of birth: 01-31-1991, Date of death: 06-06-2021

- Name: Jordan Young, Date of birth: 01-12-1982, Date of death: 09-28-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at abauman@openvallejo.org, or by phone at (707) 561-2108. Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely,
Dillon Bergin

title: Tiger Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tiger Team
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I seek all records related to a special Department of Homeland Security task force known internally as the “Tiger Team.”

On July 10, 2025, Homeland Security Investigations official Peter Hatch testified in American Association of University Professors v. U.S. Department of Justice, Civ. No. 1:25-cv-10910 (D. Mass). Hatch testified that in early 2025, DHS convened a special task force known internally as the “Tiger Team” to identify noncitizens protesting against Israel’s ongoing genocide of the Palestinian people, revoke their legal immigration status, and have them deported.

I request all records related to the Tiger Team. These include, without limitation:

1. All records related to the conception and creation of Tiger Team.
2. Records sufficient to identify the structure, composition, and membership of Tiger Team.
3. Records sufficient to identify the mission and mandate of Tiger Team.
4. All records related to the activities of Tiger Team.
5. Records sufficient to identify all other government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
6. Records sufficient to identify all non-government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
7. All records related to the oversight of Tiger Team, including records sufficient to identify the persons and entities responsible for that oversight.
8. If Tiger Team is no longer active, all records relating to the end of Tiger Team’s activities, including records sufficient to identify all reasons for ending those activities.
9. All records constituting or relating to any analysis, reports, advice, recommendations, opinions, discussions, or communications regarding the legality of Tiger Team’s activities, including whether those activities might violate the First Amendment.

Date Range: November 5, 2024 to August 1, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir

title: Palos Heights PD Immigration Enforcement

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Palos Heights PD Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

On 1/28/2025 between 1:28pm and 5:35 at least 11 ALPR queries were run by Palos Heights Police Department relating to immigration violations, looking for vehicle license plates in both Illinois and nationally across the United States. The queries include the following plates: "3376532B" "ES53782" and "CF49166". 

Please provide the following documents relating to these queries:
1) Police reports, investigative files, and case notes for the cases involving these queries. 
2) Any policies, procedures, SOPs, or internal memos from Palos Heights PD regarding working on immigration cases and cooperation with ICE. 
3) If the query was run as part of a taskforce assignment, please provide any post orders or other designations (letter of assignment, email stating they are assigned to that taskforce, etc.) that indicate the individual was assigned to the taskforce at that time.    

Thank you in advance for your time and response to this request.

title: Lake Washington School District - School District Obstruction of Federal Immigration Enforcement 2020-2025 (Juanita High School Teacher Fernando Rocha)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - School District Obstruction of Federal Immigration Enforcement 2020-2025 (Juanita High School Teacher Fernando Rocha)
communications.communication:
Lake Washington School District - School District Obstruction of Federal Immigration Enforcement 2020-2025 (Juanita High School Teacher Fernando Rocha)

via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request an electronic copy of all RECORDS and WRITING (including emails, texts, telephone call logs, faxes, etc.) in the possession of Lake Washington SCHOOL DISTRICT regarding any Federal immigration enforcement actions, any immigration related investigations, and any immigration related complaints  for the years 2020-2024.

2. I request an electronic copy of all RECORDS and WRITING (including emails, texts, telephone call logs, faxes, etc.) in the possession of Lake Washington SCHOOL DISTRICT regarding Juanita High School Teacher Fernando Rocha.

https://www.kiro7.com/news/local/wa-high-school-teacher-detained-by-ice-district-confirms/UR7VKHWYXVA33BO6ZNHISSDAAE/
https://www.kuow.org/stories/high-school-theater-manager-to-bond-out-of-tacoma-immigrant-lockup
https://www.king5.com/article/news/community/facing-race/washington-immigration/juanita-high-school-theater-manager-granted-bond-ice-custody/281-c9b3627b-c8e1-4295-8e5e-41111c7f9dac
https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/juanita-high-school-theater-manager-released-from-ice-detention/


Please begin by producing responsive records in REVERSE chronological order by year, i.e. 2025, 2024, 2022, - any Agreements, contracts,  Programs, crime or safety incidents, complaints, awards, meetings, reports, investigations, documents, communications (to or from), EMAILS (to or from), documents, etc. (RECORDS and WRITING as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4)) in the in the care, custody, control, or possession of your agency. Include Copies of LWSD policies or procedures addressing interaction with ICE or federal immigration authorities and records of any ICE-related incidents reported to or handled by LWSD in the past five years.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in reverse chronological format. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records last.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for maBenton a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst or .pdf PORTFOLIO electronic format with the most records possible included per file and per each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
The case you’ve requested is either an accident report or has one associated under this case number. To obtain, please reply to this email with your selection: Statement of Need: Pursuant to O.C.G.A. 50-18-72a (5), crash reports are limited for dissemination unless for one of the following purposes. Please indicate your statement of need. A simple reply with your selection from the below options will suffice. 
 
  *  I have a personal, professional, or business relationship with a party to the crash. 
  *  I own or lease an interest in ___________________________ (specify type of property). 
  *  I was allegedly or actually injured by the crash which is the subject of this report. 
  *  I was a witness to the crash which is the subject of this report. 
  *  I am the actual or alleged insurer of a party to the crash or of property actually or allegedly damaged by the crash which is the subject of this report. 
  *  I am a prosecutor or a publicly employed law enforcement officer. 
  *  I am alleged to be liable to another party as a result of the crash which is the subject of this report. 
  *  I am an attorney and need the requested reports as a part of a criminal case, or an investigation of a potential claim involving contentions that a roadway, railroad crossing, or intersection is unsafe. 
  *  I am a representative for _____________________ (news media). I am obtaining access to motor vehicle crash reports for the sole purpose of news gathering for my news media organization, and I affirm the use of the crash report is in compliance with O.C.G.A. 33-24-53. I am conducting research in the public interest for such purposes as crash prevention, prevention of injuries or damages in crashes, determination of fault in a crash or crashes, or other similar purposes (must be for a crash which occurred more than 60 days prior to the request). Lauren Cruz Athens-Clarke County Police Department Records Unit

title: Public Records Request - Marion County 2

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Marion County 2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://www.villages-news.com/2024/04/15/walmart-shoplifting-suspect-apprehended-in-golf-cart-at-stonecrest-pool/#google_vignette

Exact date of incident: April 14, 2024
Names of parties involved: Natalie Nicole Martin

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: Call Center Contracts & Job Classifications – RDI Corp & Vermont AHS/DCF (2021–2025) (Department for Children and Families)

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Call Center Contracts & Job Classifications – RDI Corp & Vermont AHS/DCF (2021–2025) (Department for Children and Families)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records related to contractual agreements and employment classification details involving RDI Corporation and the State of Vermont from January 1, 2021 to present. Specifically:

	1.	All contracts, MOUs, amendments, or extensions between the State (or its agencies, including AHS and DCF) and RDI Corporation for call center, hotel placement, or program eligibility services;
	2.	Job descriptions, pay ranges, and classification information for State of Vermont employees performing similar duties to those performed by RDI contractors;
	3.	Policy memos, emails, or communications detailing RDI’s responsibilities and performance expectations under the above contracts.

Please provide responsive documents in digital format. If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing the legal exemption(s) used.

I respectfully request that any fees be waived, as this request is made in the public interest for purposes of transparency and accountability regarding state-contracted service providers. I am not seeking these records for commercial use or private profit.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be fulfilled electronically (email attachment preferred; CD-ROM if unavailable).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mignon Wilson

I am requesting public records related to contractual agreements and employment classification details involving RDI Corporation and the State of Vermont from January 1, 2021 to present. Specifically:

	1.	All contracts, MOUs, amendments, or extensions between the State (or its agencies, including AHS and DCF) and RDI Corporation for call center, hotel placement, or program eligibility services;
	2.	Job descriptions, pay ranges, and classification information for State of Vermont employees performing similar duties to those performed by RDI contractors;
	3.	Policy memos, emails, or communications detailing RDI’s responsibilities and performance expectations under the above contracts.

Please provide responsive documents in digital format. If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing the legal exemption(s) used.

I respectfully request that any fees be waived, as this request is made in the public interest for purposes of transparency and accountability regarding state-contracted service providers. I am not seeking these records for commercial use or private profit.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be fulfilled electronically (email attachment preferred; CD-ROM if unavailable).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mignon Wilson

title: Boston University PD Communications

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Boston University PD Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I respectfully request access to and copies of any records in the custody of the Boston Police Department dated between January 20, 2025 and the present that meet the following criteria:

Communications, reports, or notifications submitted by or referencing the Boston University Police Department (BUPD) that relate to:

- U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

- Immigration detainers

- Requests for information on immigration status

- Custody transfers or handovers to federal immigration authorities

- Memoranda of understanding (MOUs), internal policies, procedures, or guidance documents referencing BUPD or pertaining to immigration enforcement, ICE coordination, or referrals involving university police departments.

Please include any email correspondence, incident reports, inter-agency referrals, or internal documentation where BUPD is identified as a referring, assisting, or participating agency in immigration-related matters.

If any part of this request is denied or considered overly burdensome, I ask that you provide guidance on how to narrow the request accordingly. I am happy to modify or clarify as needed.

I request that any fees be waived as this request is made in the public interest and not for commercial purposes. I am a student conducting research for educational and advocacy purposes regarding university policing and immigration enforcement. If any fees are anticipated, please inform me in advance of fulfilling the request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Vijay Fisch

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vijay Fisch

title: Trooper Activity and Incident Records Related to Mayor Wu's Appearance on July 29, 2025

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Trooper Activity and Incident Records Related to Mayor Wu's Appearance on July 29, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I respectfully request copies of all records created, received, or maintained by the Massachusetts State Police relating to trooper activity, assignments, or incidents in connection with Mayor Michelle Wu’s public appearance near Boston Medical Center on July 29, 2025. This would include those created before that day to coordinate, assign, or plan for the visit or created after that day that summarize, report, or respond to the trooper's presence, duties, or actions that took place. 

This request includes—but is not limited to—records involving:

Any Massachusetts State Police officers or troopers assigned to interact with, escort, protect, or clear areas for Mayor Wu during her visit on July 29, 2025, including in the vicinity of:
East Springfield Street
Boston Medical Center
Blunch Café
Harrison Avenue
Mass Ave Connector

Any State Police activity involving assistance to individuals on East Springfield Street, including—but not limited to—a reported instance of a trooper helping a individual off the ground shortly before Mayor Wu emerged from the BMC entrance at approximately 12:15 PM.

Records documenting assignments, movement, or coordination by State Police in connection with this visit, including:

Daily activity or shift logs for involved officers
Incident reports or field contact reports
Dispatch logs or CAD entries
Escort assignments or dignitary protection orders
Any internal email, inter-agency communication, or planning documents involving coordination with Boston Police, BMC security, ,City Hall, BPHC or another agency.
Any body-worn or vehicle camera footage.
Any photos, surveillance stills, or video logs showing the State Police present during the visit


Format & Delivery
I prefer to receive these records electronically via email in PDF, CSV, or native digital format where possible. 

If no responsive records exist for a given item, please confirm that in writing.
Please identify the systems and custodians searched, and describe how records were located.
If records exist in draft, revised, or non-final form, please include those as well.
If responsive records include logs, summaries, or databases, please provide machine-readable copies (e.g., .csv or Excel).

Thank you for your attention to this request.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Dash Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February 14, 2023)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Dash Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February 14, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Chapter 610 of the Missouri Revised Statutes, also known as the Missouri Sunshine Law, primarily deals with the public's right to access information from public governmental bodies in Missouri. 

I respectfully request copies of all dash camera footage related to the arrest of Matthew Leibach on or about February 14, 2023 at approximately 4:48 AM, by the St. Louis County Police. This is a follow up request in regards to record request #25-7072 per Shannon M.

Specifically I am requesting all dash camera camera footage recorded by any St. Louis County Police Department personnel during the detention, investigation, or arrest of Matthew Leibach also footage of the vehicle chase that resulted in Matthew Leibach crashing the vehicle at Ohio Avenue and Broadway Street in St. Louis City.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Martin

title: Data & Communications Provided to Boston Globe for Vennochi Article (July 30, 2025)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Data & Communications Provided to Boston Globe for Vennochi Article (July 30, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, this is a request for records that were supplied by City of Boston officials to the Boston Globe and cited in the following article:

“According to data supplied by city officials, so far this year in the Mass. and Cass area, there were 51 petitions for involuntary commitment under Section 35. According to this data, arrests are up, as well as what are called ‘interactions’ with people on the streets for situations involving drugs, fights, intoxication, panhandling, and vandalism.”
— Joan Vennochi, “Involuntary commitment should be on the table in the opioid crisis,” Boston Globe, July 30, 2025.
Link: https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/07/30/opinion/section-35-involuntary-commitment-drugs-alcohol-boston-mayor-race/?p1=StaffPage

As these records were created and affirmatively disclosed to the press, any deliberative process or other exemptions under G.L. c. 4, § 7(26) have been waived. Furthermore, as the responsive records have already been located, compiled, and distributed, they are not subject to search or retrieval fees pursuant to 950 CMR 32.07(2)(m).

Accordingly, please produce the following:

1.
The exact records provided to the Boston Globe or its reporter, Joan Vennochi, that contain, comprise, or were used to generate the figures and assertions in the quoted text. This includes, but is not limited to, any spreadsheet, report, data export, chart, internal briefing, or summary document showing:

The basis for the "51 petitions for involuntary commitment under Section 35" in the Mass and Cass area for the specified time period.

The data supporting the claim that "arrests are up."

The data supporting the claim that “‘interactions’... are up."

2.

All communications memorializing the transmission of these records to the Boston Globe or Joan Vennochi. This includes, but is not limited to, emails and attachments, text messages, and messages on platforms such as Slack or Microsoft Teams.

The names, titles, and departments of all city personnel who compiled, reviewed, approved, or transmitted the above-referenced information to the press. This request is for records of official government actions and is not a request for personnel files.

3
Identification of the source systems or databases used to generate the figures provided (e.g., Salesforce, Power BI, CAD logs, Mark43, internal BPHC trackers).


Please provide all responsive records in their original electronic format (e.g., .xlsx, .csv, .pdf, .msg, or .eml). Records should be produced with only the redactions that existed at the time of their original transmission to the Boston Globe. No new redactions may be applied, as any applicable exemption was waived upon prior disclosure.

This request is addressed to the Mayor’s Office as the apparent coordinating entity, with other relevant city departments copied. If any part of this request is better directed to another custodian, please specify.

If you contend that no responsive records exist, please provide a written statement detailing the custodians and locations searched, the date of the search, and the specific search terms used to make that determination.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: VBA/PACT ACT/Determination for, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: VBA/PACT ACT/Determination for, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble (SURVIVING SPOUSE) of, Robert Gribble, Deceased Date: 11/18/2011, had filed my initial claim for “SURVIVORS” Benefits in, February, 2012. My late husband, Robert Gribble; suffered from: “COLON CANCER”, while he was active duty at the age of “30”. Other health issues included: “HARD OF HEARING” (Robert Gribble filed a claim for this health issue), and received a determination, however the determination did not generate any payments. Other health issues surfaced however ; at that time some of the diseases were “NOT” classified for approval for payment. So, I was told. In, 2022, I filed a claim through the “PACT ACT” Portal. I never received anything in writing, any emails or anything. I knew that with the new “CLASSIFICATIONS”, For War Service that my claim for my late husband,  Robert Gribble (last four 5802) met the criteria, for serving in the Vietnam War and the Korean War. The dates on my “AWARD LETTER” includes the dates of when my late husband, Robert Gribble served in the, United States Army. The last four numbers of my claim number is: 5802. On my “AWARD LETTER” as the “SURVIVING SPOUSE” of, Robert Gribble, read the following “VA Benefit Information: Was the Veteran considered to be totally and permanently disabled at the time of death: NO”. I am requesting all records of applications made for benefits. I am requesting all records for payments made. I am requesting all applications filed through the “PACT ACT” PORTAL and awards made. I am requesting all documents, records and payments made, banking information, to include checking and or savings information to include, routing number, savings and or checking information. I am requesting the same for any applications and payments made by the, Veterans Benefits Administration for myself, Quancidine Hinson-Gribble and my late husband, Robert Gribble.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Quancidine Hinson-Gribble

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Freedom of Information Act Request: VBA/PACT ACT/Determination
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your email was received at the VBACO FOIA office. The information that you are requesting is not a FOIA request but a Privacy Act request. Your request has been transferred to the Customer Support Division (CSD).

To check the status of a request for records, please note you have the option to contact:

Department of Veterans Affairs
Evidence Intake Center
PO Box 4444
Janesville, WI 53547-4444
Toll-free Phone: 1-800-827-1000
Toll-free Fax: (844) 531-7818
call 1-800-827-1000 or you can submit your inquiry via  https://ask.va.gov.

Upon receipt of a request, we strive to process the request and address the needs of our Veterans and their families as expeditiously and accurately as possible. We are working diligently to process the oldest requests for information first. These requests for information represent the Veterans and their families who have been waiting the longest for their records.

Thank you for contacting the VA.
